com.mixer.interactive.services

Class ControlServiceProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mixer.interactive.services.AbstractServiceProvider
      • com.mixer.interactive.services.ControlServiceProvider

  • public class ControlServiceProvider
extends AbstractServiceProvider
    Provides all functionality relating to making requests and interpreting replies from the Interactive service regarding controls.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Microsoft Corporation
    See Also:
    InteractiveGroup

    • Method Detail

      • createControls

        public void createControls(String sceneID,
                           InteractiveControl... controls)
                    throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                           InteractiveRequestNoReplyException
        Creates one or more new controls in a scene. The client MUST provide a fully qualified, tagged control object in this method.
        Parameters:
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene that will contain the controls being created
        controls - An array of InteractiveControls to be created
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene

      • createControls

        public void createControls(String sceneID,
                           Collection<InteractiveControl> controls)
                    throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                           InteractiveRequestNoReplyException
        Creates one or more new controls in a scene. The client MUST provide a fully qualified, tagged control object in this method.
        Parameters:
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene that will contain the controls being created
        controls - A Collection of InteractiveControls to be created
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene

      • createControlsAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Boolean> createControlsAsync(String sceneID,
                                                                                       InteractiveControl... controls)

        Creates one or more new controls in a scene. The client MUST provide a fully qualified, tagged control object in this method.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Parameters:
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene that will contain the controls being created
        controls - An array of InteractiveControls to be created
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns true if the createControls method call completes with no errors
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene

      • createControlsAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Boolean> createControlsAsync(String sceneID,
                                                                                       Collection<InteractiveControl> controls)

        Creates one or more new controls in a scene. The client MUST provide a fully qualified, tagged control object in this method.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Parameters:
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene that will contain the controls being created
        controls - A Collection of InteractiveControls to be created
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns true if the createControls method call completes with no errors

        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene

      • updateControls

        public Set<InteractiveControl> updateControls(String sceneID,
                                              InteractiveControl... controls)
                                       throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                                              InteractiveRequestNoReplyException

        Updates control objects already present in a scene. The Interactive service will reply with a set of updated controls.

        The Interactive service will either update all the controls provided, or fail in which case NONE of the controls provided will be updated. In no case will the Interactive service apply updates to a subset of controls.

        Parameters:
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene containing the controls to be updated
        controls - An array of InteractiveControls to be updated
        Returns:
        A Set of updated InteractiveControls
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene

      • updateControls

        public Set<InteractiveControl> updateControls(int priority,
                                              String sceneID,
                                              InteractiveControl... controls)
                                       throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                                              InteractiveRequestNoReplyException

        Updates control objects already present in a scene. The Interactive service will reply with a set of updated controls.

        The Interactive service will either update all the controls provided, or fail in which case NONE of the controls provided will be updated. In no case will the Interactive service apply updates to a subset of controls.

        Parameters:
        priority - The priority value for the update
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene containing the controls to be updated
        controls - An array of InteractiveControls to be updated
        Returns:
        A Set of updated InteractiveControls
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene

      • updateControlsAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Set<InteractiveControl>> updateControlsAsync(String sceneID,
                                                                                                       InteractiveControl... controls)

        Updates control objects already present in a scene. The Interactive service will reply with a set of updated controls.

        The Interactive service will either update all the controls provided, or fail in which case NONE of the controls provided will be updated. In no case will the Interactive service apply updates to a subset of controls.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Parameters:
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene containing the controls to be updated
        controls - An array of InteractiveControls to be updated
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns a Set of updated InteractiveControls
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene

      • updateControlsAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Set<InteractiveControl>> updateControlsAsync(int priority,
                                                                                                       String sceneID,
                                                                                                       InteractiveControl... controls)

        Updates control objects already present in a scene. The Interactive service will reply with a set of updated controls.

        The Interactive service will either update all the controls provided, or fail in which case NONE of the controls provided will be updated. In no case will the Interactive service apply updates to a subset of controls.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Parameters:
        priority - The priority value for the update
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene containing the controls to be updated
        controls - An array of InteractiveControls to be updated
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns a Set of updated InteractiveControls

        See Also:

        Updates control objects already present in a scene. The Interactive service will reply with a set of updated controls.

      • deleteControlsAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Boolean> deleteControlsAsync(String sceneID,
                                                                                       Collection<InteractiveControl> controls)

        Removes one or more controls from the provided scene.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Parameters:
        sceneID - Identifier for an InteractiveScene containing the controls to be deleted
        controls - A Collection of InteractiveControls to be deleted
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns true if the deleteControls method call completes with no errors
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControl, InteractiveScene
